thread.title: FCA visited Barclays three times a week
thread.title_full: FCA visited Barclays three times a week

title: FCA visited Barclays three times a week
text:
Welcome to your preview of The Times Subscribe now FCA visited Barclays three times a week Barclays met supervisors at the Financial Conduct Authority 186 times last year Matt Cardy/Getty Images Barclays met supervisors at the Financial Conduct Authority 186 times last year Matt Cardy/Getty Images Harry Wilson City Editor   have visited the offices of Barclays   bank, an indication of the concern among regulators about the lender and its scandal-hit investment bank. 
Barclays met supervisors at the Financial Conduct Authority 186 times last year, 101 more visits than were performed on HSBC, the second most frequently seen bank, according to figures released under a Freedom of Information request. 
The Barclays visits easily surpass those of other British rivals, such as Lloyds Banking Group and Royal Bank of Scotland, which met FCA staff 58 and 65 times, respectively, Subscribe now 
To see the full article you need to subscribe Subscribe
